Confidence intervals for
differences of standardized regression slopes
are generated using
the `DiffBetaNB()` function from the `betaNB` package.
In this example,
we use the data set and the model used in
[betaNB: Example Using the BetaNB Function](example-beta-nb.html).


``` r
library(betaNB)
```




``` r
df <- betaNB::nas1982
```

### Regression

Fit the regression model using the `lm()` function.


``` r
object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)
```

### Nonparametric Bootstrap


``` r
nb <- NB(object)
```

### Differences of Standardized Regression Slopes

#### Normal-Theory Approach


``` r
out <- DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05)
```

## Methods

### summary

Summary of the results of `DiffBetaNB()`.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "pc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "pc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1310 5000 -0.1468 0.3673
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1249 5000  0.0016 0.4847
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1285 5000 -0.1210 0.3806
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1310 5000 -0.1542 0.3590
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1249 5000 -0.0081 0.4766
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1285 5000 -0.1127 0.3878
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bca")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bca"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1310 5000 -0.1545 0.3581
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1249 5000 -0.0092 0.4745
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1285 5000 -0.1046 0.4061
```

### coef

Return the vector of estimates.


``` r
coef(out)
#>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 
#>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410
```

### vcov

Return the sampling covariance matrix.


``` r
vcov(out)
#>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.017165176    0.008121266   -0.009043910
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.008121266    0.015589901    0.007468635
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.009043910    0.007468635    0.016512545
```

### confint

Return confidence intervals.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "pc")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.146779593 0.3672981
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP  0.001643909 0.4847116
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.120963000 0.3806350
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bc")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.154230490 0.3589529
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.008100831 0.4766114
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.112650523 0.3878115
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bca")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.154495104 0.3580656
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.009154457 0.4744867
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.104556283 0.4061334
```
